Using a mod is not cheating, it's customising. There are still rules, they're just different rules.

KSP would pretty hard to cheat at anyway. For one thing it's single-player, so cheating gets you an advantage over... uh... yourself when you're not cheating? For another, it's basically a space mission simulator - so are all simulators cheating?

I mean, actually, what the hell would be the point of cheating at KSP? To see all the planets faster? Just spend a bit of time on youtube!

Saying mods are cheating is something that could be debated, and excluding self-proclaimed cheat mods such as Hyperedit and Vessel Mover, many mod authors like to try and balance their mods towards the stock game.

 

The rest of that is something any modder is already aware of. That's like telling us air exists.

If mods are cheating, then any modern pilot flying anything more advanced than a Sopwith Camel are also big cheatypants too. As are 100% of astronauts. Mobile phones are cheating. Owning a computer is cheating. Playing KSP is cheating - if you want entertainment, real men just think fun thoughts.

But I don't think thats OPs main point, it seems that it is something like - making mods is somehow...untrustworthy/immoral? That 3rd party software is some kind of scam?
Some mods actually make the game more difficult and add realism. That's cheating somehow?  LOL
Oh no, a cheating thread. Just when you think you're out... They pull you back in. (Downs a glass of whiskey and stares resignedly into the middle distance)

KSP is the easle and mods are the paint. Some players like stock and very basic orbital/aerodynamic physics, while some people like real fuel with insulated tanks, real scale solar systems, actual concern with delta-V and TWR, real-time replica craft performing real-time replica missions, etc.

 

Mods provide us the opportunity to either enjoy the game as-is, or to customize it however we see fit based on personal preference. The amount of mods and impact they have on performance in-game is 9/10 times based on the computer you're playing on. I can rock RO/RSS with high res textures without OpenGL and run a pretty reliable save file, but then I also have a decently set up computer. 

 

Mods are good. If you don't like them, don't use them. I'm a Cheater McCheatyPants because I like the challenge of realistic rocketry after spending 200+ hours playing stock. I still enjoy the simplicity of stock every now and then though.

I'd be worried if KSP crashes the computer. This is supposed to be user-level code and not kernel-level code, or does KSP include some kernel drivers now?

If KSP is crashing the computer as opposed to crashing itself, I'd start updating graphics drivers or even replacing graphics cards if fixes aren't available. Especially on Windows, where the majority of OS crashes are from non-MS drivers or other non-MS kernel-level code these days.
